CatDescriptText: Mr. Luther Harvey, railroad company employee, 7717 Monticello Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 1, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that 18-year-olds should be given the privilege of voting?" answer reads: "They should have the right. Nowadays, they are young men and women at the age of 18, and are working and taking care of their families.  Also, they go to the Army, if there is a war."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Luther Harvey wearing dark short sleeved knit shirt with seahorse embroidery, dark cap, moustache, and eyeglasses, standing on Fifth Avenue in front of Thrift Drugs, Downtown
